org.apache.taverna.configuration

Class AbstractConfigurable

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.taverna.configuration.AbstractConfigurable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Configurable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HttpProxyConfigurationImpl

    public abstract class AbstractConfigurable
extends Object
implements Configurable
    A utility abstract class that simplifies implementing a Configurable.

    A concrete version of this class needs to define the name,category, UUID string and the set of default values.

    Author:
    Stuart Owen

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String DELETED_VALUE_CODE 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AbstractConfigurable(ConfigurationManager configurationManager)
      Constructs the AbstractConfigurable by either reading from a previously stored set of properties, or by using the default values which results in them being stored for subsequent usage.

      • setProperty

        public void setProperty(String key,
                        String value)
        Description copied from interface: Configurable
        Overwrites or applies a new value against the given key in the property map.
        Setting a value to null is equivalent to calling thisConfigurable.deleteProperty(String)
        If the value is new, or changed, the the property map is stored.
        Using this method is preferable to using the property map directly.
        Specified by:
        setProperty in interface Configurable

      • getInternalPropertyMap

        public Map<String,String> getInternalPropertyMap()
        Provides access to the internal map.
        Note that this map will contain entries for deleted values that also have corresponding default values. For this reason using this map directly is discouraged, and #getProperty(String)} should be used instead.
        Specified by:
        getInternalPropertyMap in interface Configurable
        Returns:

      • deleteProperty

        public void deleteProperty(String key)
        Description copied from interface: Configurable
        Deletes a property value for a given key.
        Subsequent calls to thisConfigurable.getProperty(String) will return null.
        Specified by:
        deleteProperty in interface Configurable

      • getPropertyStringList

        public List<String> getPropertyStringList(String key)
        Returns an unmodifiable List for the given key. Internally the value is stored as a single String, but converted to a list when calling this method.
        The list is unmodifiable to prevent the mistake of trying 
        getPropertyStringList(..).add("new element");
        which will not affect the stored list. For the property to be updated thissetPropertyStringList(String, List) must be used.
        Specified by:
        getPropertyStringList in interface Configurable

      • setPropertyStringList

        public void setPropertyStringList(String key,
                                  List<String> value)
        Set a value that is known to be a list. The value can be retrieved using thisgetPropertyStringList(String)
        Within the file, the value is stored as a single Comma Separated Value
        Specified by:
        setPropertyStringList in interface Configurable
